PerfectNetExp.abs: 仿拟（Parody）       根据家喻户晓的成语或谚语，临时更换其中的某个部分，造成新的成语或谚语；或者根据古今名言警句，在保持其原句 …
借于诙谐模仿(parody)在美国属于合理使用，特举下例说明。在美国一个专门生产新奇卡片的厂家模仿一个家喻户晓的儿童玩具—圆白 …
为一戏仿（parody）单元，似华视《连环泡》之名单元〈中国电视史〉。内容戏仿各式流行电影、电视剧，有时亦会嘲讽大学联考等。
谐拟(Parody)，以模仿为前提，添以讽刺，重新解释，给予另一种风貌。《惊声尖叫》(Scream)就是代表作品。

comparative studies of the parody words in english and chinese ., 英汉仿词比较.
...，有较大的创作自由度和“想画甚么便画甚么”的味道。在同人志中，也分为“原创同人志”(original doujinshi)和“改编同人志”(parody doujinshi)。原创同人志是指故事人物、内容、情节等，均是自己创出来的，理论上，它们的自创成分是比较高的。至于“改编同人志”，也有人称为“演绎同人志”，则.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: via late Latin from Greek parōidia 'burlesque poem', from para- 'beside' (expressing alteration) + ōidē 'ode'

entry.def: A parody is a humorous piece of writing, drama, or music which imitates the style of a well-known person or represents a familiar situation in an exaggerated way.

example.ex: 'The Scarlet Capsule' was a parody of the popular 1959 TV series 'The Quatermass Experiment'...
example.tran: 《红胶囊》戏仿了1959年大受欢迎的电视连续剧《夸特马斯试验》。

example.ex: Throughout the Twenties, Lardner tried in vain to write a hit song, so at last he turned to parody.
example.tran: 整个20年代，拉德纳尝试着想要写出一首走红歌曲，可是都失败了，于是最后转向戏仿他人的作品。

entry.tran: 戏仿；滑稽（或夸张）地模仿
entry.def: When someone parodies a particular work, thing, or person, they imitate it in an amusing or exaggerated way.

example.ex: ...a sketch parodying the views of Jean-Marie Le Pen...
example.tran: 夸张模仿让－马里·勒庞观点的短剧

entry.def: When you say that something is a parody of a particular thing, you are criticizing it because you think it is a very poor example or bad imitation of that thing.

example.ex: The first trial was a parody of justice.
example.tran: 第一次审判是对正义的愚弄。

means.word_mean: 1. a composition that imitates somebody's style in a humorous way
1. make a spoof of or make fun of
